be found, be caughtNOTE!Hi all, this is a note left by Cheif (JouzuJuls). You may find yourself wondering why 見つかる and 見つける sound so similar, these are called  自動詞[じどうし] and  他動詞[たどうし] respectively. Most verbs in Japanese come in 自動詞/他動詞 pairs. Please refer to THIS video to learn more or join our Discord server to ask me directly. https://tinyurl.com/jidoushitadoushi(Press E to edit this note to delete this message).
get up, get out of bed

word: 柿の木に実がたくさんなっています。
meaning: A lot of fruit is ripening on the persimmon tree.(Technically: On the persimmon tree, a lot of fruit is becoming) (The most natural way to say that a fruit has become ripe in Japanese is to just say that it has "become")
reading: かきのき に み が たくさん なって います

bring down, take down, pull down
go down, go down or away from a central place
as is, still (in the current state)

word: 今日は一人で映画を見ます。
meaning: Today I watched the film all by myself.
reading: 今日[きょう]は一 人[にん]で 映画[えいが]を 見[み]ます。
